blocks.name: cep
blocks.content: Extend class notation to include the membership relation.

blocks.name: df-eprel
blocks.content: Define the membership relation (also called "epsilon relation" since it is sometimes denoted by the lowercase Greek letter "epsilon"). Similar to Definition 6.22 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 30. The membership relation and the membership predicate agree, that is, ` |- ( A _E B <-> A e. B ) ` when ` B ` is a set (see ~ epelg ). Thus, ` |- 5 _E { 1 , 5 } ` ( ~ ex-eprel ). (Contributed by NM, 13-Aug-1995.)

blocks.name: epelg
blocks.content: The membership relation and the membership predicate agree when the "containing" class is a set. General version of ~ epel and closed form of ~ epeli . (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 27-Mar-2011.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 28-Apr-2015.) (Proof shortened by BJ, 14-Jul-2023.)
blocks.origin:
thm epelg(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wb(wbr(c2, cep, c0), wcel(c2, c0)))
} = {
  pm5.21ndd(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(c2, cep, c0), wcel(c2, c0), wcel(c2, universe))
  a1i(wcel(c0, c1), wi(wbr(c2, cep, c0), wcel(c2, universe)))
  sylbi(wbr(c2, cep, c0), wcel(c2, universe), wcel(cop(c2, c0), cep))
  df-br(c2, cep, c0)
  nsyl2(wcel(cop(c2, c0), cep), wcel(c2, universe), wceq(cop(c2, c0), emptycls))
  con2i(wcel(cop(c2, c0), cep), wceq(cop(c2, c0), emptycls))
  mtbiri(wceq(cop(c2, c0), emptycls), wcel(cop(c2, c0), cep), wcel(emptycls, cep))
  mtbi(wcel(emptycls, cep), wcel(emptycls, copab(hs0, hs1, wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))))
  0nelopab(hs0, hs1, wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))
  eleq2i(emptycls, copab(hs0, hs1, wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))), cep)
  eqcomi(copab(hs0, hs1, wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))), cep)
  eleq1(cop(c2, c0), emptycls, cep)
  opprc1(c2, c0)
  a1i(wcel(c0, c1), wi(wcel(c2, c0), wcel(c2, universe)))
  elex(c2, c0)
  expcom(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, universe), wb(wbr(c2, cep, c0), wcel(c2, c0)))
  brabga(hs0, hs1, c2, universe, c0, c1, cep, wcel(c2, c0), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))
  eleq12(cv(hs0), c2, cv(hs1), c0)
  df-eprel(hs0, hs1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(c2, c0))
  diff.hs1.w(wcel(c2, c0))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm epelg(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ c1 →(c2[∈]c0 ↔ c2 ∈ c0))
} = {
  pm5.21ndd(c0 ∈ c1, c2[∈]c0, c2 ∈ c0, c2 ∈ 𝕌)
  a1i(c0 ∈ c1, (c2[∈]c0 → c2 ∈ 𝕌))
  sylbi(c2[∈]c0, c2 ∈ 𝕌, < c2, c0 > ∈ ∈)
  df-br(c2, cep, c0)
  nsyl2(< c2, c0 > ∈ ∈, c2 ∈ 𝕌, < c2, c0 > = ∅)
  con2i(< c2, c0 > ∈ ∈, < c2, c0 > = ∅)
  mtbiri(< c2, c0 > = ∅, < c2, c0 > ∈ ∈, ∅ ∈ ∈)
  mtbi(∅ ∈ ∈, ∅ ∈ { < hs0, hs1 > | hs0 ∈ hs1 })
  0nelopab(hs0, hs1, hs0 ∈ hs1)
  eleq2i(emptycls, { < hs0, hs1 > | hs0 ∈ hs1 }, cep)
  eqcomi({ < hs0, hs1 > | hs0 ∈ hs1 }, cep)
  eleq1(< c2, c0 >, emptycls, cep)
  opprc1(c2, c0)
  a1i(c0 ∈ c1, (c2 ∈ c0 → c2 ∈ 𝕌))
  elex(c2, c0)
  expcom(c0 ∈ c1, c2 ∈ 𝕌, (c2[∈]c0 ↔ c2 ∈ c0))
  brabga(hs0, hs1, c2, universe, c0, c1, cep, c2 ∈ c0, hs0 ∈ hs1)
  eleq12(hs0, c2, hs1, c0)
  df-eprel(hs0, hs1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(c2 ∈ c0)
  diff.hs1.w(c2 ∈ c0)
}

blocks.name: epelgOLD
blocks.content: Obsolete version of ~ epelg as of 14-Jul-2023. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 27-Mar-2011.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 28-Apr-2015.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm epelgOLD(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wb(wbr(c2, cep, c0), wcel(c2, c0)))
} = {
  pm5.21ndd(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(c2, cep, c0), wcel(c2, c0), wcel(c2, universe))
  a1i(wcel(c0, c1), wi(wbr(c2, cep, c0), wcel(c2, universe)))
  sylbi(wbr(c2, cep, c0), wcel(c2, universe), wcel(cop(c2, c0), cep))
  df-br(c2, cep, c0)
  eleq2s(cop(c2, c0), cep, copab(hs0, hs1, wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))), wcel(c2, universe))
  sylbi(wcel(cop(c2, c0), copab(hs0, hs1, wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))), wcel(c2, universe), wex(hs0, wex(hs1, wa(wceq(cop(c2, c0), cop(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))))))
  elopab(hs0, hs1, cop(c2, c0), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))
  exlimivv(hs0, hs1, wa(wceq(cop(c2, c0), cop(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))), wcel(c2, universe))
  adantr(wceq(cop(c2, c0), cop(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wcel(c2, universe))
  simpld(wceq(cop(c2, c0), cop(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))), wcel(c2, universe), wcel(c0, universe))
  mpbiri(wceq(cop(c2, c0), cop(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))), wa(wcel(c2, universe), wcel(c0, universe)), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), universe), wcel(cv(hs1), universe)))
  pm3.2i(wcel(cv(hs0), universe), wcel(cv(hs1), universe))
  vex(hs0)
  vex(hs1)
  opeqex(c2, c0, cv(hs0), cv(hs1))
  a1i(wcel(c0, c1), wi(wcel(c2, c0), wcel(c2, universe)))
  elex(c2, c0)
  expcom(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, universe), wb(wbr(c2, cep, c0), wcel(c2, c0)))
  brabga(hs0, hs1, c2, universe, c0, c1, cep, wcel(c2, c0), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))
  eleq12(cv(hs0), c2, cv(hs1), c0)
  df-eprel(hs0, hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(cop(c2, c0))
  diff.hs1.c(cop(c2, c0))
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(c2, universe))
  diff.hs1.w(wcel(c2, universe))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(c2, c0))
  diff.hs1.w(wcel(c2, c0))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm epelgOLD(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ c1 →(c2[∈]c0 ↔ c2 ∈ c0))
} = {
  pm5.21ndd(c0 ∈ c1, c2[∈]c0, c2 ∈ c0, c2 ∈ 𝕌)
  a1i(c0 ∈ c1, (c2[∈]c0 → c2 ∈ 𝕌))
  sylbi(c2[∈]c0, c2 ∈ 𝕌, < c2, c0 > ∈ ∈)
  df-br(c2, cep, c0)
  eleq2s(< c2, c0 >, cep, { < hs0, hs1 > | hs0 ∈ hs1 }, c2 ∈ 𝕌)
  sylbi(< c2, c0 > ∈ { < hs0, hs1 > | hs0 ∈ hs1 }, c2 ∈ 𝕌, ∃(hs0, ∃(hs1,(< c2, c0 > = < hs0, hs1 > ∧ hs0 ∈ hs1))))
  elopab(hs0, hs1, < c2, c0 >, hs0 ∈ hs1)
  exlimivv(hs0, hs1, (< c2, c0 > = < hs0, hs1 > ∧ hs0 ∈ hs1), c2 ∈ 𝕌)
  adantr(< c2, c0 > = < hs0, hs1 >, hs0 ∈ hs1, c2 ∈ 𝕌)
  simpld(< c2, c0 > = < hs0, hs1 >, c2 ∈ 𝕌, c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  mpbiri(< c2, c0 > = < hs0, hs1 >, (c2 ∈ 𝕌 ∧ c0 ∈ 𝕌), (hs0 ∈ 𝕌 ∧ hs1 ∈ 𝕌))
  pm3.2i(hs0 ∈ 𝕌, hs1 ∈ 𝕌)
  vex(hs0)
  vex(hs1)
  opeqex(c2, c0, hs0, hs1)
  a1i(c0 ∈ c1, (c2 ∈ c0 → c2 ∈ 𝕌))
  elex(c2, c0)
  expcom(c0 ∈ c1, c2 ∈ 𝕌, (c2[∈]c0 ↔ c2 ∈ c0))
  brabga(hs0, hs1, c2, universe, c0, c1, cep, c2 ∈ c0, hs0 ∈ hs1)
  eleq12(hs0, c2, hs1, c0)
  df-eprel(hs0, hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(< c2, c0 >)
  diff.hs1.c(< c2, c0 >)
  diff.hs0.w(c2 ∈ 𝕌)
  diff.hs1.w(c2 ∈ 𝕌)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(c2 ∈ c0)
  diff.hs1.w(c2 ∈ c0)
}

blocks.name: epeli
blocks.content: The membership relation and the membership predicate agree when the "containing" class is a set. Inference associated with ~ epelg . (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 11-Apr-2012.)

blocks.name: epel
blocks.content: The membership relation and the membership predicate agree when the "containing" class is a setvar. (Contributed by NM, 13-Aug-1995.) Replace the first setvar variable with a class variable. (Revised by BJ, 13-Sep-2022.)

blocks.name: 0sn0ep
blocks.content: An example for the membership relation. (Contributed by AV, 19-Jun-2022.)

blocks.name: epn0
blocks.content: The membership relation is nonempty. (Contributed by AV, 19-Jun-2022.)
